properties.title: early morning at campground
properties.description: I was woken early by raucous birdsong. I wallowed around in my own grime for a bit before finally getting up. I packed up camp and got an early start to the day.

properties.title: worst 'bike path' evar
properties.description: The first part of the day was along the Erie Bayfront Parkway, a sad excuse for a bikeway - really just a wide sidewalk with horrible curb cuts. It didn’t help that I had to readjust my tarp a few times before I finally got it into a place that wasn’t interfering with my back wheel.

properties.title: donuts and coffee and local gossip
properties.description: I made it to a donut shop in the west of town, where I had two decent donuts and a cup of coffee while watching the ins and outs of the establishment.

properties.title: this town is depleted i cant even find a coffee shop the roads are a tragedy oof
properties.description: Ashtabula was incredibly depressing, featuring a completely empty downtown and some of the worst-paved streets I’ve seen. I was expecting to stop by but there were no open coffee shops in town.

properties.title: eat my dunkies while local schoolkids give me weird looks
arrive at suburban best western
properties.description: I am now in Mentor, Ohio, but wish I had booked two nights in Cleveland. I was worried that today would be too long if I were to go all the way but I think it would have been fine. The hotels in Cleveland were some kind of pricey, though.

properties.title: have ok salad/sandwich from local italian deli
